edu.belmont.mth.visigraph.models.functions
Interface FunctionBase

All Known Implementing Classes:
CountCrossings
public interface FunctionBase

The FunctionBase interface defines the minimal implementation requirements of graph-evaluating functions.

Author:
Cameron Behar

Method Summary
 boolean allowsDynamicEvaluation()
          Returns a boolean indicating whether or not this function may be evaluated dynamically.

Method Detail

evaluate

java.lang.String evaluate(java.awt.Graphics2D g2D,
                          Graph g,
                          java.awt.Component owner)
Evaluates the function on the specified graph and returns its result as a String

Parameters:
g2D - the Graphics2D context onto which the graph has been rendered
g - the Graph on which to evaluate this Function
owner - a Component used to show modal dialogs requesting more parameters from the user, if necessary
Returns:
a String representing this Function's result

allowsDynamicEvaluation

boolean allowsDynamicEvaluation()
Returns a boolean indicating whether or not this function may be evaluated dynamically. For subclasses that modify the graph in any way, or otherwise perform computationally expensive operations, it is advised that this method always return false.

Returns:
true if dynamic evaluation is allowed, false otherwise

allowsOneTimeEvaluation

boolean allowsOneTimeEvaluation()
Returns a boolean indicating whether or not this function may be evaluated statically. For subclasses designed to evaluate graphs progressively over time it is advised that this method always return true.

Returns:
true if one-time evaluation is allowed, false otherwise
